Package com.j2igf.core

Class Engine

java.lang.Object
com.j2igf.core.Engine
public final class Engine extends Object
This is the main class of the framework. It is responsible for managing the main loop and the application contexts. It also provides access to the window, renderer, input and time instances.
Author:
Aryan Rai

  • Nested Class Summary

    This is an inner class that implements the Runnable interface.

    • currentInterrupts

      private long currentInterrupts
      This is a long that stores the interrupts that will be handled at the end of evey loop integration. Depending on which bit is set, the corresponding interrupt will be handled.

    • nextContextIndex

      private int nextContextIndex
      This is an integer that stores the index of the next context.

  • Constructor Details

    • Engine

      public Engine(Window window, int targetFixedFPS)
      This is the constructor of the Engine class.
      Parameters:
      window - This is an object of the Window class. It can not be null.
      targetFixedFPS - It sets the target frames per second. It must be between 15 and 120 inclusive.

  • Method Details

    • handleInterrupt

      private void handleInterrupt()
      This method is used to handle the interrupts.

    • start

      public void start()
      This method is used to start the main loop.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      This method is used to stop the main loop.

    • addContext

      public void addContext(Class<? extends Context> contextClass)
      This method is used to set the context class at the specified index. It shall only be called before starting the engine.
      Parameters:
      contextClass - Class of the context. It can not be null.

    • switchContext

      public void switchContext(int index)
      This method is used to switch the context. It shall only be called from within a context.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the context. It must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than the total number of contexts.

    • createContext

      private Context createContext(Class<? extends Context> contextClass)
      This method is used to create a context of the specified class.
      Parameters:
      contextClass - Class of the context. It can not be null.
      Returns:
      Instance of the context.
